page.title: 13Gravel Pit
page.content: We visited the Gravel Pit and talked to Mr Elson.The Gravel Pit is 17 years old and it was 2 years before the plant was constructed.The area of 550 acres used to be farm land and when they have finished digging out the sand they will make it back to farm land.The filling will be P.F.A. P.F.A. is the waste ash from the power stations.There are 4 sizes of gravel,6 millimetre is the smallest and is used for building blocks and some of it is sent to Scotland for pebble dashing houses. The next size is 10 millimetres,it is used for buildings and and roadways the 40 millimetres is mainly drainage and 20x5 is used for concrete, mainly in Birmingham. There were 14 people working there and now there are 11, It was a very interesting visit.
